isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - LOCKING DIFFERENTIAL INTERFACE

svcproc.title: LOCKING DIFFERENTIAL INTERFACE
svcproc.para: LOCKING DIFFERENTIAL RELAY (494) has ignition voltage on terminals 1 & 2 from circuits 13X, 13Y, inline ignition fuse (225), and 13Z. Ignition voltage is applied through the normally closed contacts, circuit 49C to energize the Differential Lock Solenoid (226) and allow air to flow through the solenoid to engage the locking differential.
Gray TCM connector (3031) terminal 22 will place a ground on circuit 122 and 167 to energize the LOCKING DIFFERENTIAL RELAY (494) when the vehicle speed is greater than 22 MPH (35.4 KPH).
This will remove ignition voltage from circuit 49C, which will close the Differential Lock Solenoid (226) closing off air to the differential lock.
